title: Introducing narrator
text: Starting simplest table one dimension one measure. overall sales volume well outlying Territories analyzed. Sales across Territories 10 M. Outlying Territories Sales EMEA (5 M, 49.6 %), NA (3.9 M, 38.4 %).
code: df_one <- sales %>%   group_by(Territory) %>%   summarise(Sales = sum(Sales, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   arrange(desc(Sales))  kable(df_one) narrate_descriptive(df_one)

title: Introducing narrator
text: Sales across Territories 8.8 M. Outlying Territory Sales EMEA (5 M, 56.4 %). Outlying Productlines Sales Classic Cars (3.5 M, 39.6 %), Vintage Cars (1.6 M, 18.7 %).
code: df_two <- sales %>%   filter(Territory %in% c("NA", "EMEA")) %>%   group_by(Territory, Productline) %>%   summarise(Sales = sum(Sales, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   arrange(desc(Sales))  kable(df_two) narrate_descriptive(df_two)

title: Introducing narrator
text: Key argument narratives coverage. used narrate important things avoid simple looping dimension levels.  default coverage set 0.5 means narration stop soon cumulative sum reaches 50 % mark. increased coverage, additional narrative returned. Sales across Productlines 10 M. Outlying Productlines Sales Classic Cars (3.9 M, 39.1 %), Vintage Cars (1.9 M, 19 %). Sales across Productlines 10 M. Outlying Productlines Sales Classic Cars (3.9 M, 39.1 %), Vintage Cars (1.9 M, 19 %), Motorcycles (1.2 M, 11.6 %), Trucks Buses (1.1 M, 11.2 %).
code: df_three <- sales %>%   group_by(Productline) %>%   summarise(Sales = sum(Sales, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   arrange(desc(Sales))  df_three %>%   mutate(Share = round(Sales/sum(Sales)*100, 1),          Cumulative = cumsum(Share)) %>%   kable() narrate_descriptive(df_three) narrate_descriptive(df_three, coverage = 0.7)

title: Introducing narrator
text: Template-based systems based calculations individual variables, combining together inside template. can return list calculated variables full narrative realization: Let’s change template narrative function rework wording well changing ‘’ ‘’ since Sales plural: Overall Sales Productlines equal 10 M. Outlying Productlines Sales Classic Cars (3.9 M, 39.1 %), Vintage Cars (1.9 M, 19 %). can set templates using usethis::edit_r_environ() setting environment variable using data science platform capabilities. [1] “” Outlying Productlines Sales Classic Cars (3.9 M, 39.1 %), Vintage Cars (1.9 M, 19 %). method little handy setting .Renviron variable names using certain convention adding use_renviron = TRUE narrate function. example created variable uses unique part function name, underscore, template name - descriptive + - + template_total Sales across Productlines 10 M. Outlying Productlines Sales Classic Cars (3.9 M, 39.1 %), Vintage Cars (1.9 M, 19 %).
code: narrate_descriptive(df_three, coverage = 0.7, return_data = TRUE) #> $template_total #> Sales across all Productlines is 10 M.  #>  #> $narrative #> Sales across all Productlines is 10 M.  #> Outlying Productlines by Sales are Classic Cars (3.9 M, 39.1 %), Vintage Cars (1.9 M, 19 %), Motorcycles (1.2 M, 11.6 %), Trucks and Buses (1.1 M, 11.2 %).  #>  #> $template_outlier_final #> Outlying Productlines by Sales are Classic Cars (3.9 M, 39.1 %), Vintage Cars (1.9 M, 19 %), Motorcycles (1.2 M, 11.6 %), Trucks and Buses (1.1 M, 11.2 %).  #>  #> $measure #> [1] "Sales" #>  #> [[5]] #> [1] "Productline" #>  #> $total #> [1] "10 M" #>  #> $outlier_insight #> [1] "Classic Cars (3.9 M, 39.1 %), Vintage Cars (1.9 M, 19 %), Motorcycles (1.2 M, 11.6 %), Trucks and Buses (1.1 M, 11.2 %)" narrate_descriptive(   df_three,   template_total = "Overall {measure} for all {pluralize(dimension1)} are equal to {total}. ") Sys.getenv("descriptive_template_total") narrate_descriptive(   df_three,template_total = Sys.getenv("descriptive_template_total")   ) narrate_descriptive(df_three, use_renviron = TRUE)

title: Create Descriptive Narrative — narrate_descriptive
text: df Data frame tibble, can aggregated raw measure Numeric measure function create calculations , NULL take first numeric field available dimensions Vector dimensions analysis, default character factor variable used coverage Portion variability covered narrative, 0 1 coverage_limit Maximum number elements narrated, overrides coverage avoid extremely verbose narrative creation template_total glue template total volumes narrative template_outlier glue template single outlier narrative template_outlier_multiple glue template multiple outliers narrative use_renviron Whether use .Renviron variables template return_data return list variables used function's templates ... arguments passed glue::glue
